text: [Music]
after I wrote in a different voice I did
this work on girls which was in some
ways for me the most revelatory and
radical
because there was I Heard a Voice in
girls my colleagues and I did that was
at once familiar and surprising and it
was an honest voice and it was an it was
girls saying what they knew and then we
watched girls struggle to keep that
voice in their relationships and I think
women right now have I think that work
has had a huge effect on women because
it said there's a you know that voice is
in you and if you're not hearing it
where is it and I think the shifts in in
our culture have provided a lot more
resonance for a woman to say well
actually this you know this is what I
think um I remember I had a graduate
student uh this was in I would call what
I'd call the olden days who was in her
thesis orals and she was asked a
question and she said well if I were to
speak for myself and I said to her as
opposed
to I mean who are you speaking for if
not for yourself and we live in a
democracy which means as Citizens we
need to all speak for ourselves and
that's how the Democracy function so I
think yes I think women are in very
different look at the world there I mean
it's changed and it's not
changed
um there are women in all kinds of
places where there weren't no women
before so it's obviously you can't have
those changes without changing
everybody's intimate lives everybody's
lives and relationships have
changed um and then there are things
that haven't changed like look at who
are the heads of the Fortune 500
companies but it's changing I mean look
at the countries of the world where
there's a woman president I mean Chile
and Germany
and one of the African countries and so
it's huge we're in the middle of it
right now that's what I
think
